Line 1: Line 1: â
'''Occupy UC Davis''' is an ongoing series of [[Occupy Movement]] demonstrations at [[UC Davis]]. It is distinguished from the off-campus but allied [[Occupy Davis]]. Occupy UC Davis gained international attention on November 18, when University police were filmed pepper-spraying a group of protesters as they were peacefully seated.<ref>CS Monitor [http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1119/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-smear-tactics-Occupy-protests-face-rougher-response UC Davis Pepper-Sprays Protestors]</ref>
+
'''Occupy UC Davis''' is an ongoing series of [[Occupy Movement]] demonstrations at [[UC Davis]]. It is distinguished from the off-campus but allied [[Occupy Davis]]. Occupy UC Davis gained international attention on November 18, when University police were filmed pepper-spraying a group of protesters as they were peacefully seated.<ref>CS Monitor [http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1119/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-smear-tactics-Occupy-protests-face-rougher-response UC Davis Pepper-Sprays Protestors]</ref>
  +   +
[[Laura Flanders]] described the events as a "[[Bull Connor]] Moment", in reference to the Birmingham, Alabama leader who infamously deployed firehoses and attack dogs against peaceful protestors during the [[American Civil Rights Movement]]<ref>[http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/amex/eyesontheprize/story/07_c.html PBS's Eyes on the Prize segment, including video of Connor.]</ref><ref>[http://www2.nbc13.com/vtm/news/local/article/bull_connors_tank_returns_to_birmingham/39865/ Connor's Tank Returns to Birmingham]</ref><ref>Laura Flanders, Nov 19, 2011 "Up with Chris Hayes"</ref>
